credentials: PHD 2020 Univ of Michigan at Ann Arbor
name: FENG ZHU

ratings.comment: He isn't the greatest teacher - his lectures are somewhat hard to follow, and when he is asked questions, he doesn't explain very well. However, he is pretty funny, and the curve in the class is very nice. I can't say I learned much in this class but I somehow managed to get an A.

He's so funny during lectures, which are also recorded for those who learn better by watching on their own. The class is very organized in terms of the lectures, notes, and grading. Personally, sometimes his teaching on certain concepts was difficult to follow IMO because there wasn't as much visualization. However, very doable to do well in course

Incredible professor. I had heard a lot of warnings about Linear Algebra but this class was a breeze. Dr. Zhu was extremely clear on his expectations. Regularly attending lectures was the best thing that I did, although it wasn't mandatory, he posted all his recordings online in the same day. 
Kudos to the course coordinator Dr. Philipson as well.
He's a fairly new teacher, so for teaching such a hard class, he did a great job. Very thorough and good at explaining.
He's funny, goofy, and silly, while effectively teaching material. The lectures were engaging and personable. If you have the opportunity to take a class with Feng Zhu DO IT

Feng is honestly a legend. Funny guy, tests are pretty easy, and he's very realistic about what he expects from us. Only complaint is that he's not great at answering questions when asked in lecture lol

Feng is a funny guy and one of the few math professors here who actually enjoys giving lectures. The guy loves Monty Python and the Holy Grail and makes duck calls during class. Also, he is a very good instructor with good, clear cut slides that are posted on canvas after class.
